title: Practice: Compressed Finance Data Archive
description:
Build a compressed archive system for your Personal Finance Tracker that:

1. Compresses monthly transaction files with zstd
2. Creates a compressed archive of multiple months
3. Calculates and reports compression statistics
4. Implements extract functionality
5. Compares compression levels

**Use compression.zstd features:**
- `zstd.compress()` for compression
- `zstd.decompress()` for decompression
- Different compression levels for comparison
instructions: Build a compressed archive system for your Personal Finance Tracker that compresses transaction data and reports statistics.

hints.text: Use `json.dumps(data).encode('utf-8')` to convert to bytes before compressing. Use `Path(path).write_bytes(compressed)` to save. Use `zstd.decompress()` and `json.loads()` to restore.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to encode strings to bytes
Using high compression levels for all data
commonMistakes.consequence: Very slow compression with minimal benefit
commonMistakes.correction: Use level 3 (default) for most cases, higher only for archival
